result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Damon Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 12-02-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence BUT CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER with credit for FIVE (5) DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
*Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Damon Alexander

records.addlTxt: Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence BUT CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER with credit for FIVE (5) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 12-02-2019 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in Court with Attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing. Court held colloquy with Defendant. 

Sidebar held.

For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered Defendant to complete TEN (10) HOURS of COMMUNITY SERVICE and provide verification to the Court. Furthermore, Court ordered Defendant to write a reflection letter.  

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION at this time.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant WAIVED his right to Counsel for the purposes of this hearing.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant CONCEDED that he is the individual listed in the complaint as the perpetrator.  State advised that given the age of the DPA AND the length of time on the warrant, they are moving to REVOKE the DPA.  State advised that Victim notification is an issue.  Court noted that the recommendation in case of non-compliance is FORTY-FIVE (45) DAYS.  Defendant advised that he has served a total of FIVE (5) DAYS.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.
Review hearing scheduled for September 25, 2018 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court by telephone.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

**COURT VACATED THE STAYED WARRANT FROM THE PREVIOUS DATE**

After examination, Court found that Defendant FREELY and of his OWN will WAIVED his right to Counsel for the purposes of this hearing.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that PO MOLINA investigated further into this matter and the victim positively identified the Defendant as RAYMOND D ALEXANDER DOB 11-22-1992.  That individual has been identified as the individual on the phone.  Court cautioned Defendant against further non-appearances.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court ISSUED and STAYED a Bench Warrant until the next date.  State to investigate this matter further with the Victim.  Court ordrered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Status conference scheduled for July 3, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court by telephone with attorney Calvin Malone for William Anthony Rakestraw as a friend of the Court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court advised Defendant to go to the OSPD and retain an attorney.  Defendant to obtain representation prior to the next date.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for June 5, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
DEFENDANT RELEASED WITHOUT BAIL.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 5/8/18 at 8:30am, Branch 33.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
from DHS regarding defendant
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont on behalf of William Anthony Rakestraw in court. Brad Alan Vorpahl on behalf of David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
For reasons stated on the record by the Court, the September 25, 2017 order was in error. Should have been for correct defendant Raymond Devon Alexander (#15CF4385). For further reasons stated on the record, Court vacates competency evaluation and re-issues bench warrant previously ordered. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be re-issued as cancelled in error.  Court ordered NO bail posted to be forfeited. October 16, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. Doctor's Report Return is VACATED in Branch 33 (Honorable Judge Ashley's court). Parties have no objections. Public defender's office will follow-up with Department of Corrections (DOC) and Judge Hansher's Court, Branch 42 for correct case #15CF4385 (defendant is in custody).
Appointing Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael as Counsel of Record.  sdg

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed Dated 05-03-2016.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for plea hearing, however defense and state requests more time.  Court order bench warrant stayed vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed Dated 04/20/2016

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea/dpa.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed Dated 04/11/2016.
Justice Point Program violation report: Missed Telephone Contact; received and filed. Court reviewed violation and takes no action at this time. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea / DPA in Branch 31. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. 

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 31. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated February 2, 2016; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Michelle D.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.

Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Raymond Damon Alexander in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Request for Substitution of Judge, received and filed.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 31.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
